events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th resulting in visible damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident as per the details mentioning the car collision and damage assessment requirements.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle this case to ensure timely processing and detailed investigation.
Acknowledgement was sent to the customer confirming receipt of their report and assuring that the claim will be processed promptly.
Requested the insured to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and any repair estimates to proceed with evaluation.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including the accident report and repair shop assessment, enabling further process.
The claim investigation began focusing on verifying accident circumstances and the extent of damage to determine coverage.
Investigation concluded successfully with confirmation that the insured's vehicle damage is covered under the policy terms.
A settlement proposal of $4,500 was sent to the insured outlining the payment for vehicle repair costs after depreciation adjustments.
The customer responded acknowledging the settlement proposal and requested clarification on the deductible amount applied.
The claim was formally approved following customer agreement with the terms and conditions of the settlement offer.
Payment was processed and issued to the customer's repair shop account to cover the agreed settlement amount promptly.
The claim was closed after confirmation that the vehicle repairs were completed satisfactorily and no further issues reported.
All case files and communications were archived in the company records for this closed auto accident claim for future reference.
